repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
Instead of relying of PyObject_GenericSetAttr (which looks to have been updated in Python 3.14 to ban this usage) we instead work out where the type dict is from `__dictoffset__` and manipulate that.

Fixes #6323

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -681,7 +681,46 @@ static int __Pyx_call_type_traverse(PyObject *o, int always_call, visitproc visi
 }
 #endif
 
+////////////////// LimitedApiGetTypeDict.proto //////////////////////
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+// This is a little hacky - the Limited API works quite hard to stop us getting
+// the dict of a type object. But apparently not not hard enough...

comment_data.body: … or use it only for if the type's type is exactly `type`. That would still catch the majority of extension types. The rest can then hopefully live with a penalty.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -681,7 +681,46 @@ static int __Pyx_call_type_traverse(PyObject *o, int always_call, visitproc visi
 }
 #endif
 
+////////////////// LimitedApiGetTypeDict.proto //////////////////////
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+// This is a little hacky - the Limited API works quite hard to stop us getting
+// the dict of a type object. But apparently not not hard enough...
+//
+// In future we should prefer to work with mutable types, and then make them immutable
+// once we're done (pending C API support for this).
+static PyObject *__Pyx_GetTypeDict(PyTypeObject *tp); /* proto */
+#endif
+
+////////////////// LimitedApiGetTypeDict //////////////////////
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+static Py_ssize_t __Pyx_GetTypeDictOffset(void) {
+    // TODO - if we ever support custom metatypes for extension types then
+    // we have to drop this caching.

comment_data.body: You can move the fast path (`tp_dictoffset != 0`) into  `__Pyx_GetTypeDict()` to let the C compiler inline that. The rest here is worth its own (slow) function.

tp_dictoffset can definitely be negative (and I think always is for `Py_TPFLAGS_MANAGED_DICT`) - the negative value doesn't have a special meaning except that the dict pointer is infront of the object.

On Python 3.11:

```
>>> class C:
...   pass
... 
>>> C.__dictoffset__
-48
>>> 
```

I suspect `-1` is very unlikely because it implies 1 byte pointers. But it isn't obvious that it's always forbidden so I'd rather leave this bit as is.
This doesn't look to be completely right... negative offset indicates the offset is from the end of the object instead of the start.

I've just changed the comment here for now.

That'd work as a solution, but doesn't seem worth implementing until we need it.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -681,7 +681,46 @@ static int __Pyx_call_type_traverse(PyObject *o, int always_call, visitproc visi
 }
 #endif
 
+////////////////// LimitedApiGetTypeDict.proto //////////////////////
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+// This is a little hacky - the Limited API works quite hard to stop us getting
+// the dict of a type object. But apparently not not hard enough...
+//
+// In future we should prefer to work with mutable types, and then make them immutable
+// once we're done (pending C API support for this).
+static PyObject *__Pyx_GetTypeDict(PyTypeObject *tp); /* proto */
+#endif
+
+////////////////// LimitedApiGetTypeDict //////////////////////
+
+#if CYTHON_COMPILING_IN_LIMITED_API
+static Py_ssize_t __Pyx_GetTypeDictOffset(void) {
+    // TODO - if we ever support custom metatypes for extension types then
+    // we have to drop this caching.

comment_data.body:
I think this whole error reporting code can go into `__Pyx_GetTypeDictOffset()` as well. Once the offset variable is initialised, this code should never be touched again and can completely go out of the way.

EDIT: I'd also mark the very first `tp_dictoffset == 0` check as `unlikely()` to move the one-time initialisation code and its helper function into a cold code section.

commit.message:
More robust Limited API SetItemOnTypeDict

Instead of relying of PyObject_GenericSetAttr (which looks to
have been updated in Python 3.14 to ban this usage) we instead
work out where the type dict is from __dictoffset__ and
manipulate that.

commit.message:
Move caching out a layer

and take a bit more care about dictoffset edge cases
(mostly just raising an error for now)
Move error handling outside of normal execution path.

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.7.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.

title: More robust Limited API SetItemOnTypeDict
